column4: Ok, according to the help.ubuntu.com wiki, I should install network-manager-gnome to manage my WLAN connections. However, when I reboot/relog, I get the error: "The NetworkManager applet could not find some required resources. It cannot continue."
TheNW does not start.
What am I doing wrong?
had it too today, then installed some extra things and it was good
can you specify, what "extra things" you installed?
nm will start working some time, so just keep waiting
no that's the thing, they were totally unrelated packages and I don't know what they were, a lot
I mean something fixed it, either a reboot, or something else. not sure
Do you mean that I have to wait for it to time out and then work? Or do you mean, I have to wait till a patch becomes available?
A reboot did not do it for me.
then maybe a shutdown. saw that once
a reboot didn't work for me neither, but an hour later it started to work
it is a notebook. Maybe I should remove the battery once to completely reset it. But I don't see how that would be more helpful than poking a needle into a Bill Gates doll.
just leave that battery there. try a shutdown
Done that. Did not help.
but you could bugreport it anyway, it is surely broken in some way
maybe a config script, maybe some missing dependency
So basically, I cannot use my WLAN until a patch comes up?
it might start working like for me
But I have installed all I wanted to install.
